alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 10:59AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne, south central Pulaski and western McCreary Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1059 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Powersburg, or 11 miles northeast of Byrdstown, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Slickford around 1105 AM EDT. Burfield, Oil Valley, Cooper, Parmleysville and Mount Pisgah around 1110 AM EDT. Coopersville, Barrier, Rockeybranch and Griffin around 1115 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ritner, Denney, Slavens, Kidds Crossing, Gregory, Delta, Co- Operative, Whitley City and Marshes Siding. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
